Plots.Title: Channel occupancies
Plots.Description: Multiplicities of TDC signals by channel number.

Plots.Title: Good and corrupted TDC times
Plots.Description:
"Corrupted" SigCh-s (the second bin) originate from lost or corrupted data at the DAQ level. There is always a fraction of them but is should be stable over time.

Alert if the ratio of the second bin to the first one increases.

Plots.Title: TDC times per time window
Plots.Description: Number of TDC times recorded within a single 50 microsecond time window od the DAQ system.

Plots.Title: Multiplicity of SiPM signals
Plots.Description:
Number of SiPM signals identified on a certain SiPM ID.
Should be more or less equal for every SiPM ID.
Alert if new spikes or holes appear with respect to the reference.

Plots.Title: Size of identified SiPM matrix signals
Plots.Description:
SiPM matrix signals consist of 1-4 SiPM signals from the same matrix.
The plot presents frequency of recording a matrix signal with 1,2,3 and 4 SiPM signals in coincidence.

Plots.Title: Multiplicity of SiPM matrix signals in a time window
Plots.Description: Number of SiPM matrix signals identified within a single 50 microsecond time window od the DAQ system.

Plots.Title: Hit A-B time differences vs scintillator ID
Plots.Description:
Time difference between A and B sides of a hit vs ID of the scintillator recording the hit.
Should constitute a uniform band.
The edges of the band getting jagged indicate calibration going off.
Watch out for gaps indicating problematic scintillator.

Plots.Title: Multiplicity of hits in a time window
Plots.Description: Number of hits identified within a single 50 microsecond time window od the DAQ system.

Plots.Title: Multiplicity of hits per scintillator
Plots.Description: Number of hits identified in a particular scintillator.

Plots.Title: Hit TOT vs scintillator ID
Plots.Description: Time Over Threshold (calculated with the rectangular approximation) of  a hit vs ID of the scintillator recording the hit.

Plots.Title: Event multiplicity
Plots.Description: Multiplicity of hits in event time window

Plots.Title: TOT of 2 gamma photon pairs
Plots.Description: Time Over Threshold (calculated with the rectangular approximation)
Plots.Selection criteria: Pairs of two hits in event time window

Plots.Title: Annihilation image - XY
Plots.Description: Y vs X of 2 gamma annihilation point estimated with TOF-LOR method
Plots.Selection criteria: TOT annihilation peak, hit time difference and theta back-to-back selection

Plots.Title: Annihilation image - ZX
Plots.Description: X vs Z of 2 gamma annihilation point estimated with TOF-LOR method
Plots.Selection criteria: TOT annihilation peak, hit time difference and theta back-to-back selection

Plots.Title: Annihilation image - ZY
Plots.Description: Y vs Z of 2 gamma annihilation point estimated with TOF-LOR method
Plots.Selection criteria: TOT annihilation peak, hit time difference and theta back-to-back selection

Plots.Title: 3 gamma event relative angles
Plots.Description: Sum vs. difference of two smallest relative angles between 3 photon vectors
Plots.Selection criteria: 3 photons in the event time window.

Plots.Title: Simple lifetime
Plots.Description: Time difference of 2 gamma annihilation and prompt photon emmision time
Plots.Selection criteria: Annih. and deex. TOT cut, scatter test, theta angle for back-to-back selection
